relations.target: record=00048486-n (the sum of recognized accomplishments; \""the lawyer has a good record\""; \""the track record shows that he will be a good president\"");00063834-n (an extreme attainment; the best (or worst) performance ever attested (as in a sport); \""he tied the Olympic record\""; \""coffee production last year broke all previous records\""; \""Chicago set the homicide record\"");03930191-n (sound recording consisting of a disk with a continuous groove; used to reproduce music by rotating while a phonograph needle tracks in the groove);06502164-n (a list of crimes for which an accused person has been previously convicted; \""he ruled that the criminal record of the defendant could not be disclosed to the court\""; \""the prostitute had a record a mile long\"");06649049-n (a compilation of the known facts regarding something or someone; \""Al Smith used to say, `Let's look at the record'\""; \""his name is in all the record books\"");06659969-n (anything (such as a document or a phonograph record or a photograph) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events; \""the film provided a valuable record of stage techniques\"");13424816-n (a document that can serve as legal evidence of a transaction; \""they could find no record of the purchase\"");13618229-n (the number of wins versus losses and ties a team has had; \""at 9-0 they have the best record in their league\"");00924838-v (indicate a certain reading; of gauges and instruments; \""The thermometer showed thirteen degrees below zero\""; \""The gauge read `empty'\"");01000444-v (register electronically; \""They recorded her singing\"");01002259-v (make a record of; set down in permanent form);02110264-v (be aware of; \""Did you register any change when I pressed the button?\""

account=00869308-v (furnish a justifying analysis or explanation; \""I can't account for the missing money\"");00967067-v (to give an account or representation of in words; \""Discreet Italian police described it in a manner typically continental\"");02270039-v (keep an account of);02613467-v (be the sole or primary factor in the existence, acquisition, supply, or disposal of something; \""Passing grades account for half of the grades given in this exam\"");05165115-n (the quality of taking advantage; \""she turned her writing skills to good account\"");05176564-n (importance or value; \""a person of considerable account\""; \""he predicted that although it is of small account now it will rapidly increase in importance\"");06526084-n (a record or narrative description of past events; \""a history of France\""; \""he gave an inaccurate account of the plot to kill the president\""; \""the story of exposure to lead\"");06528946-n (an itemized statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered; \""he paid his bill and left\""; \""send me an account of what I owe\"");06694296-n (a short account of the news; \""the report of his speech\""; \""the story was on the 11 o'clock news\""; \""the account of his speech that was given on the evening news made the governor furious\"");06751030-n (a statement that makes something comprehensible by describing the relevant structure or operation or circumstances etc.; \""the explanation was very simple\""; \""I expected a brief account\"");07232584-n (the act of informing by verbal report; \""he heard reports that they were causing trouble\""; \""by all accounts they were a happy couple\"");09202279-n (grounds; \""don't do it on my account\""; \""the paper was rejected on account of its length\""; \""he tried to blame the victim but his success on that score was doubtful\"");13376000-n (a statement of recent transactions and the resulting balance; \""they send me an accounting every month\"");13952070-n (a formal contractual relationship established to provide for regular banking or brokerage or business services; \""he asked to see the executive who handled his account\""

written=02220939-a (written as for a film or play or broadcast);02292312-a (set down in writing in any of various ways; \""written evidence\"");02294393-a (systematically collected and written down; \""written laws\""

senses.definition: A written account of something, as a record
